Instructions.text: Take a look at the process view. The stream entering the tank is called FEED. It has a certain grade of valuable metal, in our case copper.
As a flotation operator you want to make sure you are producing the right amount of concentrate according to your feed flow rate.
You can check that by finding the CONCENTRATION RATIO. It represents the amount of tons you need to feed the cell in order to produce one ton of concentrate.
For example, if your concentrate flow rate is 2 t/h with a feed flow rate of 10 t/h, your concentration ratio is 5. The cell is producing one ton of concentrate with 5 tons of feed.
Let's put this knowledge into practice. Adjust the air flow rate in order to answer the questions and complete the next tasks.

What is the concentration ratio of this flotation cell with the maximum air flow rate?

 Concentration ratio =
Feed flow rate / Concentrate flow rate

What Air flow rate would you use if you knew that the optimal concentration ratio for this cell was 5?

 Concentration ratio =
Feed flow rate / Concentrate flow rate
